email.title: Weekly Digest

image.title: The digest is now 'totally different yet basically the same'(tm), generated with a new custom tool :D.

email.text:
Happy new year!
Hopefully everyone has had an enjoyable break. Welcome to 2018: Filled with more coursework, more exams, and of course, more DoCSoc events! Keep reading to find out what's happening...
email.heading: IC Hack 18

event.text:
Guess who's back, back again?
Running for its seventh consecutive year, we're bringing over 300 of the UK's most creative and talented students to South Kensington for 24 hours of learning, building, fun, and networking on the weekend of 27th-28th January 2018.
This year, IC Hack will once again be hosted at Imperial College London's South Kensington campus!
Don't miss out - we will be releasing the **LAST batch of tickets on Wednesday 10th at 17.00 GMT**. The previous batch was sold in under 10 SECONDS so make sure you're ready! Tickets will be released on Eventbrite (link above). There will be two separate tickets - one for Imperial students and one for other universities. *If you are an Imperial student please select Imperial Ticket and register with your ic.ac.uk or imperial.ac.uk email*.
Please note that because of venue policies this event is only for students aged 18+.

email.heading: Felix Seeking Tech Contributors
email.text:
Felix, Imperial's weekly newspaper, is planning to expand its tech section after a successful first term and they figured Computing students might be interested in joining. The tech section covers popular science topics ranging from Formula 1 aerodynamics to gene drives, with the plan this term being to get involved with established electronics giants and review their upcoming gadgets and devices. Of course, the usual op-eds will make their appearance as well.
If this is something that interests you, send an email to tecfelix@imperial.ac.uk
email.sign:
That's all for now!
Until next time,
